result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ronald S Badillo

records.addlTxt:
9:32 AM Defendant Ronald S Badillo in court.  Attorney William A Demet in court for Ronald S Badillo.  Attorney Jennifer Flynn in court for State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Donna Moore. 
Defense has received discovery and an offer. Makes statements on the record. Seeking to set this matter for a COP.
BTC: Matter set over.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  No contact with the victim L.A.C & Y.M.C(person, property, residence or family). It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance. Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

9:01 AM Prosecuting attorney Jennifer Flynn in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Ronald S Badillo in court, in custody.  Attorney William A Demet in court for Ronald S Badillo. Court Reporter Donna Moore. 
Defense is requesting a signature bond. 
State does not object to request of a signature bond. Request no contact with victims: LAY, YMC & CJB
BTC: $500 signature bond set. RCAP monitoring. Matter set over.
Status conference scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on August 30, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Bail/bond hearing on June 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.
